intro: Fagara bluettiana, commonly known as the blue-tailed evergreen, is a member of the Rubiaceae family, native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is characterized by its striking blue-green foliage and compact, bushy growth habit. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, red berries. Its leaves are typically leathery and have a slightly aromatic scent when crushed. Fagara bluettiana is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in shaded, humid environments.
